intro: Perityle microglossa var. effusa, commonly known as the slender perityle, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has finely divided, fern-like leaves. Its small, white flowers bloom in clusters, contributing to its ornamental value in horticulture. It is often cultivated for its delicate appearance and adaptability to cooler climates.
